Class Choice

  • java.lang.Object
    • Choice

  • class Choice
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains static methods for menu options.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nick De Villiers

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Choice() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) static void calculateGrade(int markInt)
      Calculates a grade from a user input (percentage) according to these grade boundaries: A: >69 B: >59 C: >49 D: >39 E: <40
      (package private) static int checkPercentage()
      Input validity check for the grade calculator.
      (package private) static void exit()
      Method to exit the program through a menu option.
      (package private) static boolean numberRangeInformation(int lowerBound, int upperBound)
      Gives information on a range of integers determined by the user, who inputs a lower and upper bound.
      (package private) static void numbersStatistics()
      Shows the total, average, minimum and maximum of any number of integers that the user enters.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Choice

        Choice()

    • Method Detail

      • calculateGrade

        static void calculateGrade(int markInt)
        Calculates a grade from a user input (percentage) according to these grade boundaries: A: >69 B: >59 C: >49 D: >39 E: <40
        Parameters:
        markInt - Integer of the percentage given by the user.

      • numberRangeInformation

        static boolean numberRangeInformation(int lowerBound,
                                      int upperBound)
        Gives information on a range of integers determined by the user, who inputs a lower and upper bound.

        The value, square, cube, and square root of each number is shown individually in a table.

        Parameters:
        lowerBound - Integer of the lower bound to calculate from
        upperBound - Integer of the upper bound to calculate from
        Returns:
        Boolean "validInput"; handling an invalid input happens where this method is called.

      • numbersStatistics

        static void numbersStatistics()
        Shows the total, average, minimum and maximum of any number of integers that the user enters.

      • checkPercentage

        static int checkPercentage()
        Input validity check for the grade calculator. Ensures that the user enters an integer between 0 and 100. If the user fails to enter a valid integer three times, -1 will be returned.
        Returns:
        Integer "markInt", the mark that the user entered if valid, or -1 if the user failed to enter a valid integer.

      • exit

        static void exit()
        Method to exit the program through a menu option.
